meanings.definition: A line that marks the limits of an area.
meanings.sent1: The fence around the garden shows the boundaries of our property.
meanings.sent2: Respecting personal boundaries is important in any relationship.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous puppy kept testing the boundaries of the yard.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness knows no boundaries, reaching out to everyone in need.
meanings.sent5: The boundaries of the forest seemed to stretch endlessly into the distance.

meanings.definition: A limit of a subject or sphere of activity.
meanings.sent1: The rules set clear boundaries for the game.
meanings.sent2: In science, there are ethical boundaries that must be followed.
meanings.sent3: The chef pushed the boundaries of traditional cooking with his unique recipes.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity knows no boundaries, always exploring new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The boundaries of the law must be respected to maintain order in society.

meanings.definition: A limit of a person's knowledge or experience.
meanings.sent1: Learning new things helps expand our boundaries of understanding.
meanings.sent2: Traveling to different countries can broaden one's cultural boundaries.
meanings.sent3: The student was excited to push the boundaries of his academic knowledge.
meanings.sent4: Her curiosity knows no boundaries, always seeking to learn more.
meanings.sent5: The boundaries of his imagination were limitless, leading to incredible inventions.
